test_cases.Title: Verify SGP Generator Full Responsiveness on Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Open the SGP Generator application in a desktop web browser (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Edge).
Steps.Expected Result: The application loads successfully without layout issues.

Steps.Step Description: Resize the browser window to various widths (e.g., 1920px, 1366px, 1024px, 800px, 600px).
Steps.Expected Result: The layout and content adapt fluidly to each width, maintaining usability and readability.

Steps.Step Description: Interact with all primary features (e.g., navigation, form inputs, buttons) at each width.
Steps.Expected Result: All features remain accessible and functional at all tested widths.

test_cases.Preconditions: SGP Generator application is deployed and accessible via a supported desktop browser.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A
test_cases.Expected Result: SGP Generator displays and functions correctly at all common desktop resolutions.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only desktop browser responsiveness.

test_cases.Title: Verify SGP Generator Full Responsiveness on Mobile Devices (iOS and Android)

Steps.Step Description: Open the SGP Generator application in a mobile browser (Safari for iOS, Chrome for Android).
Steps.Expected Result: The application loads successfully without layout issues.

Steps.Step Description: Rotate the device between portrait and landscape orientations.
Steps.Expected Result: The layout and content adapt fluidly to both orientations, maintaining usability and readability.

Steps.Step Description: Interact with all primary features (e.g., navigation, form inputs, buttons) in both orientations.
Steps.Expected Result: All features remain accessible and functional in both orientations.

test_cases.Preconditions: SGP Generator application is deployed and accessible via a supported mobile browser.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A
test_cases.Expected Result: SGP Generator displays and functions correctly on both iOS and Android devices in all orientations.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only mobile browser responsiveness.

test_cases.Title: Verify SGP Generator Responsiveness on Tablet Devices

Steps.Step Description: Open the SGP Generator application in a tablet browser (e.g., Safari on iPad, Chrome on Android tablet).
Steps.Expected Result: The application loads successfully without layout issues.

Steps.Step Description: Rotate the tablet between portrait and landscape orientations.
Steps.Expected Result: The layout and content adapt fluidly to both orientations, maintaining usability and readability.

Steps.Step Description: Interact with all primary features (e.g., navigation, form inputs, buttons) in both orientations.
Steps.Expected Result: All features remain accessible and functional in both orientations.

test_cases.Preconditions: SGP Generator application is deployed and accessible via a supported tablet browser.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A
test_cases.Expected Result: SGP Generator displays and functions correctly on tablet devices in all orientations.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only tablet browser responsiveness.

test_cases.Title: Verify SGP Generator Layout and Functionality on Edge Case Screen Sizes

Steps.Step Description: Open the SGP Generator application in a browser or emulator set to uncommon screen sizes (e.g., 320x480, 375x667, 2560x1440).
Steps.Expected Result: The application loads successfully without layout issues.

Steps.Step Description: Interact with all primary features at each screen size.
Steps.Expected Result: All features remain accessible and functional at all tested screen sizes.

test_cases.Preconditions: SGP Generator application is deployed and accessible. Browser or emulator supports custom screen sizes.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A
test_cases.Expected Result: SGP Generator displays and functions correctly at edge case screen sizes.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only edge case screen sizes.

test_cases.Title: Verify No Horizontal Scrollbar Appears at Any Supported Resolution

Steps.Step Description: Open the SGP Generator application in a browser at various supported resolutions (desktop, tablet, mobile).
Steps.Expected Result: The application loads successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Check for the presence of a horizontal scrollbar at each resolution.
Steps.Expected Result: No horizontal scrollbar is present; all content fits within the viewport horizontally.

test_cases.Preconditions: SGP Generator application is deployed and accessible via supported browsers/devices.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A
test_cases.Expected Result: No horizontal scrollbar appears at any supported resolution; content is fully visible.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only horizontal scrolling issues.

test_cases.Title: Verify Carousel Visibility on Home Page under Standard Conditions

Steps.Step Description: Open the application and navigate to the Home Page.
Steps.Expected Result: Home Page loads successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the area designated for the carousel component.
Steps.Expected Result: Carousel is visible and displayed according to the design specifications.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged in and has access to the Home Page. Network connection is stable.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; standard network conditions.
test_cases.Expected Result: Carousel is visible on the Home Page under standard conditions.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only standard visibility, not edge or error cases.

test_cases.Title: Validate Structure of a Single Precompiled Card in Home Page Carousel

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Home Page where the carousel is displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: Carousel is visible with at least one card.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the structure of a single precompiled card within the carousel.
Steps.Expected Result: Card displays all required fields (e.g., title, image, description, CTA button) as per design.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged in; carousel contains at least one precompiled card.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; carousel with precompiled cards.
test_cases.Expected Result: Each precompiled card in the carousel matches the specified structure and content.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not cover dynamic content or error handling.

test_cases.Title: Verify Caching of Precompiled Cards on Home Page Carousel

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Home Page and allow the carousel to load with precompiled cards.
Steps.Expected Result: Carousel and cards are loaded and displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the Home Page or restart the application.
Steps.Expected Result: Carousel reloads quickly, and previously loaded precompiled cards are retrieved from cache without additional network requests.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged in; cache is empty before first load.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; empty cache at start.
test_cases.Expected Result: Precompiled cards are cached and reloaded efficiently on subsequent accesses.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Focuses on caching behavior, not cache invalidation or errors.

test_cases.Title: Verify Skeleton Loader Displayed While Carousel Content Loads on Home Page

Steps.Step Description: Simulate slow network conditions and navigate to the Home Page.
Steps.Expected Result: Home Page begins to load, but carousel content is not yet available.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the carousel area during content loading.
Steps.Expected Result: Skeleton loader (placeholder UI) is displayed until carousel content is fully loaded.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged in; network throttling is enabled to simulate slow connection.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; network throttling enabled.
test_cases.Expected Result: Skeleton loader is displayed in the carousel area until content is loaded.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not cover error states or loader disappearance timing.

test_cases.Title: Display of Randomly Generated Same Game Parlay (SGP) Precompiled Bets on Full Responsive Frontend (Italy)

Steps.Step Description: Access the Betting Full Responsive frontend (Italy version) via desktop browser.
Steps.Expected Result: The homepage loads successfully, displaying betting options.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to a sports event that supports Same Game Parlay (SGP) bets.
Steps.Expected Result: The event page loads, showing available betting markets.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the section for precompiled SGP bets generated by the SGP Generator.
Steps.Expected Result: A section labeled for SGP precompiled bets is visible on the event page.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the displayed SGP precompiled bets are generated randomly and differ on page refresh.
Steps.Expected Result: Each page refresh displays a new set of randomly generated SGP precompiled bets.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is not logged in. SGP Generator is active and integrated. Sports event with SGP support is available.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (random generation by system)
test_cases.Expected Result: Randomly generated SGP precompiled bets are displayed in the appropriate section on the event page and change on each refresh.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers display and refresh of SGP precompiled bets for Italy desktop frontend.

test_cases.Title: Verify Carosello Activation/Deactivation on Full Responsive Retail (Hot Configuration)

Steps.Step Description: Refresh or revisit the Home Page on Full Responsive Retail.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh or revisit the Home Page on Full Responsive Retail.

test_cases.Title: Verify precompiled cards are cached and persist on homepage revisit within cache duration

Steps.Step Description: Open the website and land on the homepage (HP) at time T0.
Steps.Expected Result: Precompiled cards are displayed on the homepage.

Steps.Step Description: Note the content and order of the precompiled cards displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: Content and order of precompiled cards are recorded for comparison.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the homepage to another section of the website.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully navigated to a different section; homepage is no longer visible.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the homepage within X minutes (where X is the configured cache duration).
Steps.Expected Result: Homepage is displayed again.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the precompiled cards displayed on the homepage upon return.
Steps.Expected Result: The same precompiled cards (content and order) as seen at T0 are displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: Cache duration X is configured; user is not in private/incognito mode; browser cache is enabled.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (uses default homepage precompiled cards)
test_cases.Expected Result: Upon returning to the homepage within X minutes, the user sees the exact same precompiled cards as initially displayed at T0.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers positive scenario for cache within duration.

test_cases.Title: Verify precompiled cards are refreshed after cache expiration

Steps.Step Description: Open the website and land on the homepage (HP) at time T0.
Steps.Expected Result: Precompiled cards are displayed on the homepage.

Steps.Step Description: Note the content and order of the precompiled cards displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: Content and order of precompiled cards are recorded for comparison.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the homepage to another section of the website.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully navigated to a different section; homepage is no longer visible.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for more than X minutes (where X is the configured cache duration).
Steps.Expected Result: Elapsed time exceeds the cache duration.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the homepage after cache expiration.
Steps.Expected Result: Homepage is displayed again.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the precompiled cards displayed on the homepage upon return.
Steps.Expected Result: Precompiled cards may differ from those seen at T0, indicating cache refresh.

test_cases.Preconditions: Cache duration X is configured; user is not in private/incognito mode; browser cache is enabled.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (uses default homepage precompiled cards)
test_cases.Expected Result: After cache expiration, the precompiled cards on the homepage are refreshed and may differ from those initially displayed at T0.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers cache expiration and refresh scenario.

test_cases.Title: Verify cache duration X is configurable only via release and not runtime

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to change the cache duration X via runtime configuration (e.g., admin panel, API, or environment variable) without a release.
Steps.Expected Result: System does not allow cache duration X to be changed at runtime.

Steps.Step Description: Deploy a new release with a different value for cache duration X.
Steps.Expected Result: System accepts the new cache duration X only after the release.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the new cache duration X is in effect by repeating cache persistence and expiration tests.
Steps.Expected Result: Cache behavior reflects the new duration X as configured in the release.

test_cases.Preconditions: Access to deployment/release process and configuration files; admin access if needed.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A
test_cases.Expected Result: Cache duration X can only be changed via a new release, not at runtime.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers configuration management aspect of cache duration.

test_cases.Title: Verify precompiled cards caching is user-session independent (public homepage)

test_cases.Preconditions: Cache duration X is configured; two browsers or incognito sessions available.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A

test_cases.Title: Display Only Non-Expired Events in Carousel Cards

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application and navigate to the Home Page (HP).
Steps.Expected Result: User is on the Home Page and carousel cards are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the list of events displayed in the carousel cards. Note the start date and time of each event.
Steps.Expected Result: All displayed events have a start date and time in the future (not yet passed).

Steps.Step Description: Wait until the start date and time of one or more events passes while remaining on a different page (not HP).
Steps.Expected Result: Some events become 'expired' (start date/time has passed) during navigation.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the Home Page before the cache expiry time (X minutes).
Steps.Expected Result: Only events with a start date and time in the future are displayed in the carousel cards; expired events are no longer shown.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is authenticated. At least one event in the carousel is scheduled to expire soon. Cache is valid (not expired).
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; events with varying start times (some expiring soon, some in the future).
test_cases.Expected Result: Upon returning to HP before cache expiry, only non-expired events are shown in the carousel; expired events are not displayed.

test_cases.Title: Trigger Backend Refresh When All Events Are Expired Before Cache Expiry

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application and navigate to the Home Page (HP).
Steps.Expected Result: User is on the Home Page and carousel cards are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all events in the carousel have a start date and time that will expire soon.
Steps.Expected Result: All events are scheduled to expire before the cache expiry (X minutes).

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the HP and wait until all events' start date and time have passed (all events are expired), but before cache expiry (X minutes).
Steps.Expected Result: All events become expired while the cache is still valid.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the Home Page before cache expiry.
Steps.Expected Result: Frontend detects that all cached events are expired and triggers a new backend call to fetch fresh events. The carousel is updated with new, non-expired events, and the cache timer is reset.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is authenticated. All events in the carousel are scheduled to expire before cache expiry. Cache is valid (not expired).
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; events all expiring before cache expiry.
test_cases.Expected Result: If all cached events are expired upon returning to HP, the frontend fetches new events from the backend and resets the cache timer.

test_cases.Title: Do Not Refresh Backend If At Least One Event Is Not Expired Before Cache Expiry

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application and navigate to the Home Page (HP).
Steps.Expected Result: User is on the Home Page and carousel cards are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that at least one event in the carousel has a start date and time in the future, and others are about to expire.
Steps.Expected Result: At least one event is scheduled to start after the current time; others may expire soon.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from HP and wait until some (but not all) events have expired, but before cache expiry (X minutes).
Steps.Expected Result: Some events are expired, at least one is still valid.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the Home Page before cache expiry.
Steps.Expected Result: Frontend does not trigger a backend refresh. Only non-expired events are displayed in the carousel; expired events are removed.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is authenticated. At least one event in the carousel will remain valid after others expire. Cache is valid (not expired).
test_cases.Functionality: Event Carousel Filtering and Cache Management
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; events with staggered start times.
test_cases.Expected Result: If at least one event is still valid, the frontend does not refresh from backend; only non-expired events are shown.

test_cases.Title: Expired Events Are Not Displayed After Cache Expiry and Backend Refresh

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application and navigate to the Home Page (HP).
Steps.Expected Result: User is on the Home Page and carousel cards are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Wait until the cache expiry time (X minutes) passes while remaining on a different page.
Steps.Expected Result: Cache expires.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the Home Page after cache expiry.
Steps.Expected Result: Frontend triggers a backend call to fetch new events. Only non-expired events are displayed in the carousel cards.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is authenticated. At least one event in the carousel is scheduled to expire before cache expiry. Cache is valid at login.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; events with varying start times.
test_cases.Expected Result: After cache expiry, only non-expired events are shown in the carousel following a backend refresh.

test_cases.Title: Edge Case: No Events Available After Backend Refresh

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application and navigate to the Home Page (HP).
Steps.Expected Result: User is on the Home Page and carousel cards are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Wait until all events are expired and cache expires.
Steps.Expected Result: No valid events remain and cache is expired.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the Home Page, triggering a backend refresh.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend returns no new events. The carousel displays a message indicating no events are available.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is authenticated. All events are expired and cache is expired. Backend has no new events to provide.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; no available events after backend refresh.
test_cases.Expected Result: If backend returns no events, the carousel displays an appropriate empty state message to the user.

test_cases.Title: Verify caching of precompiled cards for an event within X minutes

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the detail page of a specific event (Event A) at time T0.
Steps.Expected Result: Precompiled cards for Event A are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the event detail page to another section of the site.
Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to another section; no error occurs.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the detail page of Event A within X minutes from T0.
Steps.Expected Result: The same precompiled cards as initially displayed at T0 are shown, with no changes.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is authenticated and has access to the event detail page. X (cache duration) is configured as per business requirements.
test_cases.Dataset: Event A with precompiled cards available; valid user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: Upon returning to the event detail page within X minutes, the user sees the same precompiled cards as at the initial visit.
test_cases._polarion: Memorizzazione in cache delle precompilate su avvenimento

test_cases.Title: Verify cache expiration of precompiled cards after X minutes

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the detail page of a specific event (Event B) at time T0.
Steps.Expected Result: Precompiled cards for Event B are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the event detail page to another section of the site.
Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to another section; no error occurs.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for more than X minutes after T0.
Steps.Expected Result: Elapsed time exceeds the configured cache duration.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the detail page of Event B after X minutes have passed.
Steps.Expected Result: Precompiled cards are reloaded (may differ from those seen at T0 if data has changed).

test_cases.Preconditions: User is authenticated and has access to the event detail page. X (cache duration) is configured as per business requirements.
test_cases.Dataset: Event B with precompiled cards available; valid user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: After X minutes, returning to the event detail page causes the precompiled cards to be reloaded (not served from cache).
test_cases._polarion: Memorizzazione in cache delle precompilate su avvenimento

test_cases.Title: Verify caching of precompiled cards is user-specific and does not leak between users

Steps.Step Description: User 1 logs in and navigates to the detail page of Event C at time T0.
Steps.Expected Result: User 1 sees precompiled cards for Event C.

Steps.Step Description: User 1 navigates away from the event detail page.
Steps.Expected Result: User 1 is redirected to another section; no error occurs.

Steps.Step Description: User 2 logs in (different account) and navigates to the detail page of Event C within X minutes from T0.
Steps.Expected Result: User 2 sees precompiled cards for Event C, but these are generated for User 2 (not User 1's cached data).

test_cases.Preconditions: Two distinct user accounts exist. X (cache duration) is configured as per business requirements.
test_cases.Dataset: Event C with precompiled cards available; credentials for User 1 and User 2.
test_cases.Expected Result: Precompiled cards are cached per user session; no data leakage occurs between users.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not cover cache invalidation after X minutes.
test_cases._polarion: Memorizzazione in cache delle precompilate su avvenimento

test_cases.Title: Verify that navigating to a different event does not serve cached cards from another event

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the detail page of Event D at time T0.
Steps.Expected Result: Precompiled cards for Event D are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from Event D to another section of the site.
Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to another section; no error occurs.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the detail page of Event E within X minutes from T0.
Steps.Expected Result: Precompiled cards for Event E are displayed, not those from Event D.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is authenticated and has access to multiple event detail pages. X (cache duration) is configured as per business requirements.
test_cases.Dataset: Events D and E with precompiled cards available; valid user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: Each event detail page displays its own precompiled cards; no cross-event cache leakage occurs.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not cover cache expiration.
test_cases._polarion: Memorizzazione in cache delle precompilate su avvenimento

test_cases.Title: Verify cache refresh when precompiled cards are updated during cache period

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the detail page of Event F at time T0 and note the precompiled cards displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: Precompiled cards for Event F are displayed and noted.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the event detail page to another section of the site.
Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to another section; no error occurs.

Steps.Step Description: While away, update the precompiled cards for Event F in the backend (simulate data change).
Steps.Expected Result: Precompiled cards for Event F are updated in the backend.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the detail page of Event F within X minutes from T0.
Steps.Expected Result: The user still sees the original precompiled cards as at T0, not the updated ones (cache is respected).

Steps.Step Description: Wait until X minutes have passed since T0, then refresh the event detail page.
Steps.Expected Result: The updated precompiled cards are now displayed (cache expired and new data loaded).

test_cases.Preconditions: User is authenticated and has access to the event detail page. Ability to update precompiled cards in backend. X (cache duration) is configured as per business requirements.
test_cases.Dataset: Event F with precompiled cards available; valid user credentials; backend access to update cards.
test_cases.Expected Result: Cached precompiled cards are shown within X minutes even if backend data changes; after X minutes, updated cards are loaded.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers both cache retention and expiration with backend data change.
test_cases._polarion: Memorizzazione in cache delle precompilate su avvenimento

test_cases.Title: Verify DWH Tracking for Precompiled SGP Card Bets

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the DWH system and SGP Card Generator integration is deployed and configured as per DWH_SGP Generator specifications.
Steps.Expected Result: DWH system is operational and ready to receive bet data from precompiled SGP Cards.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate a bet using a precompiled SGP Card through the designated application channel (e.g., POS terminal, web interface).
Steps.Expected Result: Bet is successfully placed and acknowledged by the application.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the bet transaction is logged and transmitted to the DWH system with all required fields (e.g., card ID, bet details, timestamp, user ID) as specified in DWH_SGP Generator.
Steps.Expected Result: DWH receives and stores the bet data with all mandatory fields populated.

Steps.Step Description: Query the DWH system for the specific bet using unique identifiers (e.g., card ID, transaction ID).
Steps.Expected Result: The bet record is retrievable and matches the original transaction details.

test_cases.Preconditions: DWH system and SGP Card Generator integration must be deployed and configured. Test SGP Cards must be available. Access to DWH query tools is required.
test_cases.Functionality: DWH Tracking of SGP Card Bets
test_cases.Dataset: Precompiled SGP Card, valid user account, DWH access credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: Bets placed using precompiled SGP Cards are correctly tracked and stored in the DWH system according to the DWH_SGP Generator specification.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers standard bet tracking; does not include error or edge cases.

test_cases.Title: Verify DWH Tracking Failure for Invalid SGP Card Bets

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to place a bet using an invalid or corrupted precompiled SGP Card through the application channel.
Steps.Expected Result: The application rejects the bet and provides an error message.

Steps.Step Description: Check the DWH system for any record of the failed bet attempt using the card ID or transaction ID.
Steps.Expected Result: No record of the failed bet is present in the DWH system.

test_cases.Preconditions: DWH system and SGP Card Generator integration must be deployed. Invalid SGP Card must be available for testing. Access to DWH query tools is required.
test_cases.Functionality: DWH Tracking of SGP Card Bets
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid or corrupted SGP Card, DWH access credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: Failed bet attempts with invalid SGP Cards are not tracked or stored in the DWH system.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers negative scenario for invalid card usage.

test_cases.Title: Verify DWH Tracking for Multiple Bets from the Same Precompiled SGP Card

Steps.Step Description: Place multiple bets sequentially using the same precompiled SGP Card through the application channel.
Steps.Expected Result: Each bet is successfully placed and acknowledged by the application.

Steps.Step Description: Query the DWH system for all bets associated with the specific SGP Card ID.
Steps.Expected Result: All bets are individually tracked and stored in the DWH system with unique transaction records.

test_cases.Preconditions: DWH system and SGP Card Generator integration must be deployed. A valid SGP Card must be available. Access to DWH query tools is required.
test_cases.Functionality: DWH Tracking of SGP Card Bets
test_cases.Dataset: Precompiled SGP Card, DWH access credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: Multiple bets from the same SGP Card are individually tracked and stored in the DWH system.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers repeated use of the same card for multiple bets.

test_cases.Title: Verify DWH Tracking for Boundary Values in SGP Card Bets

Steps.Step Description: Place a bet using a precompiled SGP Card with minimum allowed bet value through the application channel.
Steps.Expected Result: Bet is successfully placed and acknowledged by the application.

Steps.Step Description: Place a bet using a precompiled SGP Card with maximum allowed bet value through the application channel.
Steps.Expected Result: Bet is successfully placed and acknowledged by the application.

Steps.Step Description: Query the DWH system for both bets using their transaction IDs or card ID.
Steps.Expected Result: Both bets are tracked and stored in the DWH system with correct bet values.

test_cases.Preconditions: DWH system and SGP Card Generator integration must be deployed. Precompiled SGP Cards with minimum and maximum bet values must be available. Access to DWH query tools is required.
test_cases.Functionality: DWH Tracking of SGP Card Bets
test_cases.Dataset: Precompiled SGP Cards with min/max bet values, DWH access credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: Bets with boundary values are correctly tracked and stored in the DWH system.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers boundary value scenarios for bet amounts.

test_cases.Title: Verify DWH Data Integrity for SGP Card Bets

Steps.Step Description: Place a bet using a precompiled SGP Card through the application channel.
Steps.Expected Result: Bet is successfully placed and acknowledged by the application.

Steps.Step Description: Query the DWH system for the bet record using the card ID or transaction ID.
Steps.Expected Result: Bet record is present in the DWH system.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all required fields (e.g., card ID, bet details, timestamp, user ID) are correctly populated and match the original transaction data.
Steps.Expected Result: All fields in the DWH record are accurate and consistent with the source transaction.

test_cases.Preconditions: DWH system and SGP Card Generator integration must be deployed. Precompiled SGP Card must be available. Access to DWH query tools is required.
test_cases.Functionality: DWH Tracking of SGP Card Bets
test_cases.Dataset: Precompiled SGP Card, DWH access credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: DWH records for SGP Card bets are complete, accurate, and consistent with the original transaction data.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers data integrity for tracked bets.
